intro: Ixoca marchesettii, commonly known as the Brazilian wax tree, is a species of flowering plant native to Brazil. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and large, waxy leaves that give it its common name. It produces showy, five-petaled flowers in shades of yellow and orange. Ixoca marchesettii is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional medicine.
